dataset_id: BOREAS TE-18 Geosail Canopy Reflectance Model
title: BOREAS TE-18 Geosail Canopy Reflectance Model
summary: The GEOSAIL model was created by combining the SAIL (Scattering from Arbitrarily Inclined Leaves) model with the Jasinski geometric model to simulate canopy spectral reflectance and absorption of photosynthetically active radiation for discontinuous canopies. Tree shapes are described by cylinders or cones distributed over a plane. Spectral reflectance and transmittance of trees are calculated from the SAIL model to determine the reflectance of the three components used in the geometric model: illuminated canopy, illuminated background, shadowed canopy, and shadowed background.

cmr.title: BOREAS TE-18 Geosail Canopy Reflectance Model
cmr.summary: The GEOSAIL model was created by combining the SAIL (Scattering from Arbitrarily Inclined Leaves) model with the Jasinski geometric model to simulate canopy spectral reflectance and absorption of photosynthetically active radiation for discontinuous canopies. Tree shapes are described by cylinders or cones distributed over a plane. citation: Yoshioka, H. 2004. Vegetation Isoline Equations for an Atmosphere-Canopy-Soil System. IEEE Transactions on Geoscience and Remote Sensing. 42(1):166-175.

Verhoef, W. and H. Bach. 2003. Simulation of hyperspectral and directional radiance images using coupled biophysical and atmospheric radiative transfer models. Remote Sensing of Environment. 87(1):23-41.
Huemmrich, K.F. 2001. The GeoSail model: a simple addition to the SAIL model to describe discontinuous canopy reflectance. Remote Sensing of Environment. 75(3):423-431.
